abstract: In Rupert Murdoch’s attempt to buy Dow Jones, the question of price has been on the back burner of late, overshadowed by negotiations over a framework for protecting the editorial independence of the company’s flagship publication, The Wall Street Journal.
lead_paragraph: In Rupert Murdoch’s attempt to buy Dow Jones, the question of price has been on the back burner of late, overshadowed by negotiations over a framework for protecting the editorial independence of the company’s flagship publication, The Wall Street Journal.
